ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: In this course, I learned more about the different themes of global health studies including how politics, funding, and culture impact global health interventions. Through our final project, I was able to conduct a detailed research project with a global health partner and produce a policy brief. I learned a lot about persuasive writing and communication when it comes to raising awareness of global health issues.

Lots of excellent readings about projects and leading research in the field of global health, particularly as it relates to decolonizing global health, mental health, arts-based initiatives, funding mechanisms for global health, and early childhood development. 
You also get to work with a global health practitioner to create a policy brief for a global health org (e.g. UN, Africa Development Bank).
I was able to explore other areas of Global Health that I hadn't had a chance to explore yet. I also learned how to write and develop a policy brief .

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
The policy brief did not have the best structure to it and I wish we had more guidance.
Overall it was nice to have a class with my entire senior cohort.
I really enjoyed the client interactions, and hopefully the teams can be formed earlier in the semester in the future

Strengths: excellent instructors, excellent community, good insights into the field of global health practice and research, overall wonderful course
Weaknesses: should start policy brief in week 2 and have regular class meetings throughout. policy brief groups should be constricted to folks in the same section

I really enjoyed the client format of the course and thought it made it very applicable to real life and more interesting. I also very much enjoyed the guest speakers and the UN visit. I would've appreciated more discussion based work instead of lecture-style presentations.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes -- it is a requirement for GHS

Absolutely! I deeply enjoyed this course. Dr. Panter-Brick and Dr. Fallon are so wonderful, and I looked forward to seeing my classmates every week. I wish there had been more opportunities for individual short essay (1 page) writing or more structure and time for the policy brief.
